sentences: Harvard-MIT Division of Health Sciences and Technology
[LIST_ITEM] Attachment of endometrial cells to the peritoneal surface
[LIST_ITEM] Invasion of these cells into the mesothelium
[LIST_ITEM] No cases reported prior to puberty
[LIST_ITEM] Short cycle and longer flows have twice the risk of endometriosis
[LIST_ITEM] Viable endometrial tissue is refluxed through the fallopian tubes during menstruation
[LIST_ITEM] Implants on peritoneal surface or pelvic organs
[LIST_ITEM] Refluxed endometrial cells are able to adhere to peritoneum
[LIST_ITEM] Ovary & Mullerian ducts derive from coelomic mesothelium
[LIST_ITEM] Germinal epithelium attempts to recapitulate endometrium
[LIST_ITEM] Develops from metaplasia of cells that line the pelvic peritoneum
[LIST_ITEM] Infectious, hormonal, or other inductive stimuli may result in metaplasia
[LIST_ITEM] Injection into ear vein of rabbit causes endometriosis of lungs
[LIST_ITEM] Lymphatic and hematogenous dissemination of endometrial cells
[LIST_ITEM] Evidence suggests that endometrial cells can metastasize
[LIST_ITEM] Pleura, umbilicus, retroperitoneal space, lower extremity, vagina, and cervix - are anatomically possible
[LIST_ITEM] Endometrial tissue in uterine veins in women with adenomyosis
[LIST_ITEM] Induced pulmonary endometriosis by injecting endometrial tissue intravenously in rabbits
[LIST_ITEM] Lymph node endometriosis was found to be present in 6.7% autopsies
[LIST_ITEM] Much more common in patients with a FH
[LIST_ITEM] More severe in women with a + first degree relative
[LIST_ITEM] Endometrial fragments obtained in either phase of the cycle – adhere to the epithelial side of the amnion but only at locations where the amniotic epithelium was damaged or absent
[LIST_ITEM] Cultured peritoneal explants adhered to peritoneal explants only at locations where the mesothelium was absent or damaged and the basement membrane was exposed
[LIST_ITEM] Intact mesothelium constitutes a defense barrier
[LIST_ITEM] Occasionally there is attachment to intact mesothelium
[LIST_ITEM] Integrin-blocking antibodies do not interfere with endometrial stromal or epithelial cell adherence to mesothelium
[LIST_ITEM] Hyaluronic acid is expressed along the cell membrane and contributes to the pericellular matrix
[LIST_ITEM] Major component of the extracellular matrix ground substance
[LIST_ITEM] CD44 is the principal receptor for hyaluronic acid
[LIST_ITEM] Involved in binding of gastric cancer and ovarian cancer cells to mesothelium
[LIST_ITEM] Endometrial stromal end epithelial cells express CD44
[LIST_ITEM] Hyaluronidase pretreatment of mesothelial cells decreases the binding of endometrial stromal and epithelial cells to mesothelium
[LIST_ITEM] MMPs (and inhibitors) play a significant role in normal endometrial remodeling that accompanies menses
[LIST_ITEM] MMP family contains several structurally related Zn++ dependent endopeptidases
[LIST_ITEM] Responsible for the degradation of various extracellular matrix components
[LIST_ITEM] Produced by endometrial tissue in response to progesterone
[LIST_ITEM] Antibody to TGF-β abolishes this suppression
[LIST_ITEM] Blocking the action of TGF-β opposes progesterone-mediated suppression of MMP-3 and MMP-7
[LIST_ITEM] Blocks the ability of progesterone to prevent experimental endometriosis
[LIST_ITEM] TGF-β alone does not lead to sustained suppression of MMPs
[LIST_ITEM] Possibly because of resumption of MMP production in the absence of progesterone
[LIST_ITEM] Consistent with the fact that peritoneal fluid levels of TGF-β are elevated in endometriosis
[LIST_ITEM] Potent stimulator of MMP-3 in proliferative phase endometrium
[LIST_ITEM] Progesterone exposure in vivo reduces the IL-1α stimulation of MMP-3 in secretory phase tissue
[LIST_ITEM] IL-1α stimulation of MMP-3 is restored in a dose-dependent manner with progesterone withdrawal
[LIST_ITEM] Cultured endometriotic cells obtained from a rat endo model express higher levels of MMP-3 mRNA than eutopic rat endometrial stromal cells when treated with progesterone

[LIST_ITEM] Elevated and persistent MMP-3 expression by endometriotic stromal cells cultured in the presence of progesterone correlates with elevated levels of IL-1α mRNA detected in the endometriotic stromal cells
[LIST_ITEM] Production of IL-1α by the endometriotic lesions - overcomes the progesterone-induced suppression of MMP-3
[LIST_ITEM] IL-1α - related mechanism promotes MMP-3 production by endometriotic cells even in the presence of progesterone
[LIST_ITEM] Aromatase catalyzes the synthesis of estrone and estradiol from androstenedione and testosterone, respectively
[LIST_ITEM] Expressed by many human cell types
[LIST_ITEM] Estrogen produced by aromatase activity in the cytoplasm of leiomyoma smooth muscle cells or endometriotic stromal cells
[LIST_ITEM] Disease-free endometrium and myometrium lack aromatase expression
[LIST_ITEM] Cultured stromal cells derived from endometriotic implants and incubated with a CAMP analog display extraordinarily high levels of aromatase
[LIST_ITEM] Growth factors, cytokines - possible inducers of aromatase
[LIST_ITEM] Prostaglandin E2 was identified as the most potent inducer
[LIST_ITEM] Stimulates cyclo-oxygenase type 2 enzyme in endometrial stromal cells
[LIST_ITEM] Positive feedback loop for continuous local estrogen and prostaglandin E2 production
[LIST_ITEM] Possible genetic defect in aromatase expression in endo
[LIST_ITEM] Androstenedione of adrenal and ovarian origins – premenopausal women
[LIST_ITEM] 17α-hydroxysteroid dehydrogenase (17α-HSD) type 1 is expressed in endometriosis
[LIST_ITEM] In contrast 17α-HSD type 2 inactivates estradiol by catalyzing its conversion to estrone in eutopic endometrial glandular cells during the luteal phase
[LIST_ITEM] Inactivation of estradiol to estrone one of the anti-estrogenic properties of progesterone
[LIST_ITEM] 17α-HSD type 2 is absent from endometriotic glandular cells

[NUMBERED_ITEM] Where is endometriosis most commonly found?
[NUMBERED_ITEM] What clinical impact does endometriosis have on the woman?
[NUMBERED_ITEM] What treatment modalities are available for endometriosis?
